text: Hi guys! Without the beta can i develop a crm card with a private app?
<@U01QVR44MEY> what do u think? you are the best on this
Yeah those cards (JSON Based Cards) are now deprecated
They will continue to work until March 31, so you definitely only want to move forward with building using the React Beta
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/upcoming-sunset-json-custom-cards>
thank you carter but how do I proceed if I can't activate the beta in the portal?

cit :
and any new JSON cards uploaded will be blocked ->
this is not true , I managed to build even though it says they will be deprecated from September in a HubSpot account without beta activation. <@U01QVR44MEY>

What seems absurd to me is that, having a client portal that cannot access this React beta, they can still use the JSON-based cards which will be deprecated. So, the question for the HubSpot team is: if I need to make a CRM card ( sidebar ) for internal use by the client, what do I have to do? Am I forced to make a public app? This seems absurd to me.
why can't the client use react cards?
'cause they don't have enterprise subscription
They would have to have enterprise to use the JSON cards, though... unless I'm missing something
Strange because I am trying on the portal and they are working the same....
maybe i found a bug hahaha
Yep needs a Sales or Service ENT subscription: "To join the beta as a Sales or Service Hub Enterprise customer" <https://developers.HubSpot.com/blog/crm-development-tools-for-HubSpot-developers-beta>

<@U018962HD47> the new UI extensions that are built with CRM development tools have always been on Sales or Service enterprise accounts, including the to be deprecated JSON ones. 

This depreciation doesn't impact the CRM cards that are created through CRM extensions API on public apps.
So if you are able to create a JSON-based card you definitely should be able to create a React card.
It is strange cause i'm not in a sales or service enterprise account but i can create Json-based cards but not react ones
Have you gone to the product-updates section and then in the betas and search for the react one
And also just to make sure, we're talking about not having a sale or service enterprise hub, not a sales or service seat in the portal
yep i don't see react beta :disappointed:
well this is strange
<@U03FJQPSC0Y>, you're going to have to take over here. haha
:laughing:
